meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by melanin.
meanings.sent1: The melanic skin of the bear helped it blend into the forest surroundings.
meanings.sent2: Her melanic hair shone beautifully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The melanic cat thought it was a ninja with its dark fur.
meanings.sent4: The melanic clouds covered the sky like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The melanic feathers of the crow made it look mysterious and elegant.

meanings.definition: Having a high concentration of melanin.
meanings.sent1: The melanic lizard basked in the sun to absorb more warmth.
meanings.sent2: People with melanic skin are less prone to sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The melanic flower seemed to soak up all the sunlight like a sponge.
meanings.sent4: The melanic soil retained heat better than the lighter soil.
meanings.sent5: The melanic bird's wings were strong and beautiful, perfect for flying.

meanings.sent1: The melanic beetle crawled stealthily in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: The melanic rocks absorbed heat quickly under the sun.
meanings.sent3: The melanic sweater was perfect for hiding stains.
meanings.sent4: The melanic night sky was dotted with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The melanic snake slithered silently through the grass.
